meanings.def: a person who buys and sells goods in large quantities, especially one who imports and exports goods
examples: Venice was once a city of rich merchants.

meanings.def: a person who sells goods to the public, especially through a store
examples: The credit cards are accepted by 10 million merchants worldwide.

meanings.def: a person who likes a particular activity
examples: a speed merchant (= somebody who likes to drive fast)
noise merchants (= for example, a band who make a lot of noise)

meanings.def: a person who predicts that things will go very badly
examples: The doom merchants who said television would kill off the book were wrong.

meanings.def: a person who predicts that things will go very badly
